page.title: 11ECOLOGY -Forestry Commission
page.content: The Forestry Commission control about 7000 acres of land.They grow mainly Scots Pine and Corsican Pine,some 41/2 million,with growth of 2200 tons/year. One man can fell about 30/40 trees a day and this is done in small patches all over the land to avoid large bare patches. Some border areas have Silver Birch to break the scenery. Young seeds are grown in Japanese pots to make a good start.This has improved germination.Sometimes the cleared land is ploughed and sometimes seedlings are hand planted directly.Each small tree is protected from animals by a plastic tube of about 75cm. The type of forest doesnt provide much habitat for wild life.Red squirrels are being encouraged and pools drained and kept as reserves.The Nuthatch , Greater Spotted Woodpecker and Nightjar are resident. (Class J3 Age 10)
